page.title: 16Coalport China Works
page.content: At Coalport there is a China Works which is now a museum showing the techniques of china manufacture and the products of Coalport.China was made here until 1926 when the company moved to Staffordshire. The museum opens at 10.00am and closes at 5.00pm every day.It costs Â£1.75 to go in and it has 200-400 visitors a day.There is a car park,toilets,a cafe and a souvenir shop which sells Coalport china as well as pens,rubbers,postcards and such like. The works is owned and run by the Ironbridge Gorge Museum Trust which also operates sites at Blists Hill,Coalbrookdale and Ironbridge.
